apple: A fruit that is typically round, red, and edible.
banana: A long curved fruit with a yellow skin.
dog: A domesticated carnivorous mammal that typically has a long snout, an acute sense of smell, and a barking, howling, or whining voice.
elephant: A very large plant-eating mammal with a trunk and long curved ivory tusks.
fish: A limbless cold-blooded vertebrate animal with gills and fins living wholly in water.
giraffe: A large African mammal with a very long neck and forelegs, having a coat patterned with brown patches separated by lighter lines.
horse: A large plant-eating domesticated mammal with solid hooves and a flowing mane and tail, used for riding, racing, and to carry and pull loads.
igloo: A dome-shaped Eskimo house, typically built from blocks of solid snow.
jaguar: A large, heavily built cat that has a yellowish-brown coat with black spots, found mainly in the dense forests of Central and South America.
koala: An Australian tree-dwelling marsupial that has a backward-facing pouch, feeds on eucalyptus leaves, and is noted for its sluggish behavior.
lion: A large tawny-colored cat that lives in prides, found in Africa and northwestern India.
monkey: A small to medium-sized primate that typically has a long tail, most kinds of which live in trees in tropical countries.
narwhal: A small Arctic whale that has a long tusk-like tooth, usually in the male, that projects from the left side of the upper jaw.
ostrich: A flightless swift-running African bird with a long neck, long legs, and two toes on each foot. It is the largest living bird, with males reaching an average height of 8 feet.
penguin: A flightless seabird of the Southern Hemisphere, known for its black-and-white plumage and its upright posture.
quokka: A small marsupial with a short tail, found in Western Australia. It is a herbivorous and mainly nocturnal animal, and is known for its friendly and approachable behavior.
rabbit: A small burrowing mammal with long ears, soft fur, and a divided upper lip, native to Eurasia and Africa and widely kept as a pet or for food.
snake: A long limbless reptile that has no eyelids, a short tail, and jaws that are capable of considerable extension. Some snakes have a venomous bite.
tiger: A large carnivorous cat that is native to Asia, with a distinctive orange coat with black stripes. It is an endangered species.
umbrella: A device consisting of a circular canopy of cloth on a folding metal frame supported by a central rod, used as protection against rain.
vulture: A large bird of prey that feeds primarily on carrion, having a bald head and weak claws, and usually soaring or circling above its prey.
whale: A very large marine mammal with a streamlined hairless body, a horizontal tail fin, and a blowhole on top of the head for breathing.
xylophone: A musical instrument played by striking a row of wooden
